oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHAPE SELECTIVE REACTIONS OF SOME ORGANIC-COMPOUNDS ON THE ZEOLITE KZ-1
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RANE, SJ
CHAKRABARTY, DK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: toluene disproportionation
xylene isomerization
zsm-5 zeolites
meta-xylene
catalysts
alkylation
ethylbenzene
deposition
methanol
ethylbenzene alkylation
ethylbenzene decomposition
kz-1
magic angle spinning nmr of kz-1
shape selectivity
toluene alkylation
zeolites
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reaction of ethylbenzene, alkylation of toluene with methanol and that of ethylbenzene with ethanol have been studied on the medium pore, high silica zeolite KZ-1 under varying experimental conditions. The zeolite showed a stable catalytic activity and verv high selectivity for the formation of para-dialkylbenzenes. The results suggest that the zeolite KZ-1 has a unidimensional channel structure with ten-membered ring opening, possibly with elliptical shape.
